description.narrative:
Reprogrammed funds to address COVID-19 The ultimate goal of the project is to contribute to increased economic efficiency and effectiveness in budget allocations that take into account different needs of both women and men. The GRB project in Ukraine was initiated by the Ministry of Finance of Ukraine (MoF) which demonstrates a commitment and understanding of the importance of GRB in enhancing the ongoing public finance reform. The project will improve the budget process by introducing gender equality through a socio-economic analysis method.
The Project started in 2013. This is an extension of the Project till 31-12-2020. The new extended activities cover GRB institualisation, work with educational establishments and to include the GRB into the curricula of civil servants and training to ensure a sustainable provision of skilled practitioners in GRB.

Omprogrammerade medel för att bekämpa covid-19 Projektets långsiktiga mål är att bidra till att öka den ekonomiska effektiviteten inom budgetallokeringar som beaktar mäns och kvinnors olika behov. GRB (Gender Responsive Budgeting)-projektet i Ukraina initierades av landets Finansdepartement som visar engagemang och förståelse för vikten av GRB inom pågående reformer av budgetprocessen. Projektet kommer att förbättra budgetprocessen genom stärkt integrering av jämställdhet.
Det här är en förlängning av det pågående projektet till 2020-12-30 och SEK 23 895 266 läggs till. De utökade aktiviteterna inkluderar institutionalisering av GRB, arbete med utbildningsinstitutioner och ett inkluderande av GRB i läroplaner för tjänstemän för att på så sätt stärka deras kompetens och säkerställa hållbar implementering av GRB vid Finansdepartementet.

tag.narrative: 10.3 - Ensure equal opportunity and reduce inequalities of outcome, including by eliminating discriminatory laws, policies and practices and promoting appropriate legislation, policies and action in this regard.

10.3 - Säkerställa lika möjligheter och minska förekomsten av ojämlika utfall, bland annat genom att avskaffa diskriminerande lagstiftning, politik och praxis och främja lagstiftning, politik och åtgärder av lämpligt slag i detta hänseende.
5.c - Anta och stärka välgrundad politik och genomförbar lagstiftning för att främja jämställdhet och öka alla kvinnors och flickors egenmakt på alla nivåer
5.c - Adopt and strengthen sound policies and enforceable legislation for the promotion of gender equality and the empowerment of all women and girls at all levels.

description.narrative: This conclusion on performance covers the period January-December 2019. The narrative, financial and audit reports were received according to the schedule stipulated in the agreement. Results for the state level: 1) The project continued working on institutionalization of GRB: in addition to approving "Methodological Recommendations on Implementing and Using the Gender Responsive Approach in the Budget Process" in January 2019, within the course of 2019 the Ministry of Finance approved three orders that regulate the use of the gender-based approach in the budget process: the Order No. 145 of 8 April 2019 “On performance indicators of a budget program”, the Order No. 446 of 23.10.2019 “On state budget spending reviews”; 2) The project drafted the policy paper “Gender responsive budgeting in Ukraine: working towards sustainability in the MF of Ukraine”, and submitted it to the Ministry of Finance; 3) During 2019, the Project provided support to build capacity of key spending unites (KSUs) and specialists of he Ministry of Financestructural units on the use of the Methodological Recommendations. The trainings covered 42 KSUs and lower-level spending units. In total, 207 representatives of KSUs and spending units (SUs) very covered by GRB trainings; 4) 52 programs financed from the state budget covered by gender analysis; Results for local level: 1) 325 programs financed from local budgets include gender aspects;2) workshops delivered in 343 amalgamated territorial communities (ATCs);3) training provided to 568 persons on the local level (515 women and 53 men);esults at local level: Other results: 1) 15 persons graduated from the 4th GRB Trainers School (14 women and 1 men);2) 8,222 persons acquired knowledge due to the online course “Gender responsive budgeting for community development”. The financial report describes the project expenses by the approved budget lines. The unspent amounts for 2019 have been integrated in the budget for 2020. The audit report for Niras Sweden AB for the period 01.01.2019 – 31.12.2019 is unqualified. The Management Letter has been provided, management response as well. In conjunction with the audit, the auditor's assessment is that the project has been conducted according to the agreement and approved budget. The audit report for Niras Ukraine LLC for the period 01.01.2019 – 31.12.2019 is also unqualified. In auditor's opinion, the financial information in the report is prepared in all material respects in accordance with Sida's conditions for finance reporting.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
